Neo4j Query: MATCH (n) WHERE n.name CONTAINS $term OR n.title CONTAINS $term OR n.text CONTAINS $term OR n.content CONTAINS $term OR n.summary CONTAINS $term RETURN labels(n)[0] as type, n.id as id, COALESCE(n.name, n.title, n.text, 'Unknown') as title, COALESCE(n.summary, n.content, '') as content LIMIT 50
Query Explanation: Searches all properties across all node types using CONTAINS for partial matching. Uses COALESCE to handle different property names across node types.
Use Case for Agents: Agents can discover related knowledge by searching for keywords or concepts

Description: Get counts of all nodes and relationships
Neo4j Query: MATCH (n) WITH labels(n)[0] as nodeType, count(n) as nodeCount RETURN nodeType, nodeCount UNION ALL MATCH ()-[r]->() WITH type(r) as relType, count(r) as relCount RETURN relType as nodeType, relCount as nodeCount
Query Explanation: Uses UNION ALL to combine node counts and relationship counts in single query. Groups by node labels and relationship types.
Use Case for Agents: Agents can understand the composition and scale of the knowledge graph

Description: Find shortest path between two nodes
Parameters: from (required): source node ID, to (required): target node ID, depth (optional): max path length (default: 3)
Neo4j Query: MATCH path = shortestPath((from {id: $from})-[*1..$depth]-(to {id: $to})) RETURN [node in nodes(path) | {id: node.id, type: labels(node)[0], name: COALESCE(node.name, node.title, node.text)}] as nodes, [rel in relationships(path) | type(rel)] as relationships, length(path) as pathLength
Query Explanation: Uses Neo4j's shortestPath algorithm with variable-length patterns. Extracts nodes and relationships from path object. Handles different node properties with COALESCE.
Use Case for Agents: Agents can trace knowledge connections and understand how concepts are related

Parameters: id (in path): node ID, depth (optional): neighborhood depth (default: 1)
Neo4j Query: MATCH (center {id: $nodeId}) OPTIONAL MATCH path = (center)-[*1..$depth]-(neighbor) WITH center, collect(DISTINCT neighbor) as neighbors, collect(DISTINCT [rel in relationships(path) | {type: type(rel), from: startNode(rel).id, to: endNode(rel).id}]) as pathRels RETURN {id: center.id, type: labels(center)[0], name: COALESCE(center.name, center.title, center.text), properties: properties(center)} as centerNode, [n in neighbors | {id: n.id, type: labels(n)[0], name: COALESCE(n.name, n.title, n.text)}] as neighbors, REDUCE(rels = [], relList in pathRels | rels + relList) as relationships
Query Explanation: Complex query that finds center node and all neighbors within specified depth. Uses OPTIONAL MATCH to handle nodes without neighbors. Uses REDUCE to flatten relationship arrays from multiple paths.
Use Case for Agents: Agents can analyze local context around specific knowledge nodes

Query Explanation: Executes multiple analytical queries: 1) Finds concepts with most relationships using count(r) 2) Counts unverified claims with is_verified = false 3) Counts open questions 4) Finds concepts without DERIVED_FROM relationships
Use Case for Agents: Agents can identify knowledge quality issues and suggest areas for improvement

Description: Get all relationships for a specific node
Neo4j Query: MATCH (n)-[r]-(m) WHERE elementId(n) = $node_id RETURN elementId(n) as from_id, type(r) as rel_type, elementId(m) as to_id
Query Explanation: Uses elementId() for precise node matching. Finds all relationships (incoming and outgoing) using bidirectional pattern. Returns relationship type and connected node IDs.
Use Case for Agents: Agents can map all direct connections for relationship analysis
